security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing no executable code. The skill provides guidance on using the scikit-bio Python library for bioinformatics analysis. All files are markdown documentation and JSON metadata with code examples demonstrating legitimate biological data analysis operations.

content.user_title: Analyze biological sequences and microbiome data
content.value_statement: Complex biological data analysis requires specialized tools for sequences, phylogenetics, and diversity metrics. This skill provides expert guidance on using scikit-bio for DNA/RNA/protein sequence analysis, phylogenetic tree construction, and statistical testing for microbiome research.
actual_capabilities: DNA, RNA, and protein sequence manipulation and validation
Phylogenetic tree construction using UPGMA, NJ, and other algorithms
Alpha and beta diversity calculations including UniFrac distances
Ordination methods like PCoA, CCA, and RDA for data visualization
Statistical tests including PERMANOVA, ANOSIM, and Mantel test
FASTA, FASTQ, GenBank, Newick, and BIOM file format support
limitations: Requires scikit-bio library installation for actual computation
Does not execute analysis code directly in the conversation
Focused on guidance rather than producing final analysis outputs
Does not provide pre-computed results or datasets

use_cases.title: Analyze microbial community diversity
use_cases.description: Calculate alpha and beta diversity metrics from OTU tables to compare sample communities.

use_cases.title: Build phylogenetic trees from sequences
use_cases.description: Construct and analyze evolutionary trees from DNA sequences using distance-based methods.

use_cases.title: Perform statistical testing on biological data
use_cases.description: Run PERMANOVA and other permutation-based tests to assess group differences in ecological data.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Sequence
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to read a DNA sequence from a FASTA file and perform reverse complement and translation to protein.

prompt_templates.title: Diversity Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I calculate Shannon diversity and Bray-Curtis distance from a sample-by-feature counts matrix?

prompt_templates.title: Phylogenetics
prompt_templates.prompt: Construct a phylogenetic tree from a distance matrix and calculate Robinson-Foulds distance to compare with another tree.

prompt_templates.title: Statistics
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a PERMANOVA test to determine if three treatment groups have significantly different community composition based on a distance matrix.

output_examples.input: How do I analyze microbiome diversity between treatment and control groups?
output: Read your feature table with Table.read('table.biom')
Calculate alpha diversity with alpha_diversity('shannon', counts, ids=sample_ids)
Compute beta diversity with beta_diversity('braycurtis', counts, ids=sample_ids)
Run PERMANOVA with permanova(distance_matrix, grouping, permutations=999)

best_practices: Install scikit-bio with uv pip install scikit-bio before running analysis code
Use generators for large sequence files to minimize memory usage
Validate sequence inputs using DNA, RNA, or Protein classes with alphabet constraints
anti_patterns: Loading entire large FASTA files into memory instead of using generators
Using relative abundances instead of integer counts for diversity calculations
Running PERMANOVA without first checking dispersion with PERMDISP

faq.question: What Python version does scikit-bio require?
faq.answer: scikit-bio requires Python 3.9 or later. Check compatibility before installation.

faq.question: What file formats are supported for sequence input?
faq.answer: FASTA, FASTQ, GenBank, EMBL, and QSeq formats are supported with automatic format detection.

faq.question: Can I integrate results with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes, scikit-bio works with pandas, numpy, matplotlib, and QIIME 2 artifacts.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only provides guidance. All analysis runs locally with the scikit-bio library you install.

faq.question: Why is my alignment failing?
faq.answer: Ensure sequences are degapped and of comparable length. Check for unexpected characters in sequences.

faq.question: How does this compare to QIIME 2?
faq.answer: scikit-bio provides lower-level functionality. QIIME 2 offers higher-level workflows that use scikit-bio internally.
